questions.question_text: A technician would like to implement a low-latency Wi-Fi network. Which of the following standards should the technician deploy for the network if the expected user bandwidth is 450Mbps?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A. 802.11a-54mbps
B. 802.11b- 11mbps
C. 802.11g-54mbps
D. 802.11n-600 mpbs

Selected Answer: D
i think D, based on its the most up to date standard to choose from.

Selected Answer: D
D. 802.11n

Selected Answer: D
802.11n offers higher data rates and better performance compared to 802.11a, 802.11b, and 802.11g. It supports multiple input, multiple output (MIMO) technology, which allows for increased data throughput and improved efficiency, making it a good choice for higher bandwidth requirements.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D. 802.11n.

Selected Answer: A
attacker gets un-authorised access to network and changes access port to trunk port

Selected Answer: A
A. VLAN hopping

VLAN hopping is an attack where an attacker exploits a misconfigured switch to gain unauthorized access to VLANs other than the one they should be in. In this case, if an attacker is on an isolated guest network and successfully performs VLAN hopping, they could potentially gain access to the corporate network, which is a security breach.

comments.content: ideally the guest and corporate network should be on different vlans so by vlan hopping he/she would gain access

discussion.content: This depends on the context. Guest Network via physical or wireless? Can anyone provide an opinion on this question?

questions.question_text: Which of the following attacks, if successful, would provide a malicious user who is connected to an isolated guest network access to the corporate network?

choices.C: Configure separate channels on APs that are not supporting the conference room.
choices.A: Remove the current antennas and replace them with directional antennas on each AP.
choices.D: Reboot the switch and each AP at the same time.
choices.B: Disconnect the AP and move it closer to the conference room.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
yeah probably this one, during business hours change the channels on the AP's except the conference rooms AP, reducing channel overcrowding and congestion. THis would be the least disruptive to the all important conference room users.

Selected Answer: C
I guess C

Selected Answer: C
C. Configure separate channels on APs that are not supporting the conference room.

questions.question_text: A network administrator implements a group of access points, only changing the SSID, credentials, and IP address. Shortly after, users begin reporting poor quality and video loss while on video calls in the conference room. Which of the following should the administrator do to MOST effectively troubleshoot during business hours?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Updating the device wireless drivers

The first troubleshooting step the network administrator should recommend in this scenario is updating the device wireless drivers. Slow wireless speeds on new laptops, while other devices are not experiencing the same issue, could be due to outdated or incompatible wireless drivers on the laptops. Updating the drivers can often improve compatibility and performance.

Selected Answer: D
D - Seems to be the only logical answer to this question. Standard image I assume is the image that will be deployed by Microsoft WDS, USB or DVD or something like that?

Selected Answer: D
D. Updating the device wireless drivers

choices.C: Changing the protocol associated to the SSID

questions.question_text: A desktop support department has observed slow wireless speeds for a new line of laptops using the organization's standard image. No other devices have experienced the same issue. Which of the following should the network administrator recommend troubleshooting FIRST to resolve this issue?

The following configuration is applied to a DHCP server connected to a VPN concentrator:
//IMG//

There are 300 non-concurrent sales representatives who log in for one hour a day to upload reports, and 252 of these representatives are able to connect to the
VPN without any Issues. The remaining sales representatives cannot connect to the VPN over the course of the day. Which of the following can be done to resolve the issue without utilizing additional resources?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If you originally thought it was the subnet mask. The quest says "non-concurrent sales reps. So some of their computers are holding on to leases. Answer A will help bring back some the the IP's for reallocation.

Selected Answer: A
Decreasing the lease time allows for you to limit their connectivity time. Because they aren't concurrently connected, if they have too high of a lease time then they can simply sit there connected hogging the network connections available. Also as another point, decreasing the lease time does not cost any excess resources to be used in order to assist in increasing the availability of the network connections.
The best answer is E. increase the subnes mask to 255.255.254.0. But alas, they forgot to put that one in. Probably a typo, so go for A. Then find a better long term solution.

Selected Answer: A
The 300 sales representatives are non-concurrent (not at the same time) members of network only on for an hour a day. The cheapest & simplest option is decreasing the lease duration to allow trade-off of resources.

Selected Answer: A
Decrease the lease duration - They're exhausting all of the available IP addresses in the DHCP scope for VPN clients. Excluding the network address (10.0.0.0), DHCP server (10.0.0.1) and gateway IP (10.0.0.254), the DHCP scope that the server can give out would range from 10.0.0.2 to 10.0.0.253. This would be 252 usable addresses, which the number of representatives that were able to connect. This isn't enough for all 300 sales representatives, so decreasing the lease duration would make sense here since they only login for an hour a day to upload reports.

Selected Answer: A
A. Decrease the lease duration

Selected Answer: A
Decreasing the lease duration with help the DHCP server to relocate the resources available.
